introduce.title: About AngusTester Issues
introduce.description: Issue management helps teams collaborate efficiently, track progress, and deliver on time.
introduce.workItem1: Plan project activities and scheduling through iterations;
introduce.workItem2: Assign tasks clearly with responsible parties for efficient collaboration;
introduce.workItem3: Monitor project health and progress trends in real-time.

emptyStates.noCreatedIssues: You haven't added any issues yet,
emptyStates.noConfirmingIssues: You have no issues to confirm

introduce.title: About Backlog
introduce.description: Backlog is a task list containing Product Backlog and Sprint Backlog. Used to manage team work tasks, covering all current and future work items.
introduce.productBacklogDesc: Product requirements list maintained by Product Manager, containing feature requests, bug fixes, and technical improvements, sorted by priority.
introduce.sprintBacklogDesc: Current sprint work items selected from Product Backlog, defining specific tasks the team will complete in this sprint.

typeDescriptions.requirement: User expectations or requirements for business, functionality, etc., with broad descriptions.
typeDescriptions.story: Specific goals or expectations that users want to achieve, usually described in concise, understandable language, such as: As a <role>, I want <goal> so that <benefit>.
typeDescriptions.apiTest: API functionality, performance, and stability testing tasks
typeDescriptions.scenarioTest: Scenario functionality, performance, and stability testing tasks

descriptions.assignee: Person responsible for actually executing assigned work issues.
descriptions.confirmer: Person responsible for verifying and validating work results, will automatically enter confirmation process when assigned.
descriptions.tester: Person responsible for testing and validating product functionality or service quality.
descriptions.evalWorkload: Estimated value of work issue volume, comprehensive difficulty, and complexity.
descriptions.actualWorkload: Actual value of work issue volume, comprehensive difficulty, and complexity.
descriptions.tags: "Issue tags" can help you organize issues with common points, such as "project name, sprint version, business identifier", etc.

messages.contactAdminForTags: Please contact administrator to configure issue tags in "Project" - "Tag".
messages.fileSizeLimit: Single file size not exceeding {size}M, maximum 5 files

aiGenerate.title: Auto Create Backlog
aiGenerate.aiKeywordsPlaceholder: Describe your requirements to the AI agent, such as: Generate 10 main Wiki system product Backlogs.

split.aiPlaceholder: Describe your requirements to the AI agent, such as: Split task "{taskName}" into multiple subtasks.

introduce.title: About Sprint
introduce.description: Sprints break down projects into fixed time cycles (usually 1-4 weeks) of work units. Each sprint has clear goals, deliverables, and acceptance criteria, ensuring teams continuously deliver value. Teams can better plan work, track progress, identify risks, and conduct retrospectives and improvements at the end of each sprint.

benefits.organizeWorkDesc: Break down complex projects into manageable iterations with clear goals and deliverables
benefits.enhanceCollaborationDesc: Facilitate communication and collaboration among team members to improve work efficiency
benefits.improveTransparencyDesc: Increase visibility into project progress and issues for better management and decision-making
benefits.improveFlexibilityDesc: Quickly respond to changes and adjust priorities and plans
benefits.improveQualityDesc: Ensure product quality through continuous integration and testing
benefits.enhanceSatisfactionDesc: Increase customer and team satisfaction through rapid delivery and feedback

placeholders.inputAcceptanceCriteria: Define specific conditions and standards for software product delivery
placeholders.inputOtherInformation: Additional notes such as sprint strategy, risk assessment and management

tips.ownerTip: The owner is responsible for overall sprint planning and execution, including task assignment, progress tracking, and risk management
tips.issuePrefixTip: Issue prefix helps identify issues belonging to this sprint for easier management and tracking
tips.evalWorkloadMethodTip: Workload assessment method estimates task effort to help the team plan sprints better
tips.attachmentTip: Supports uploading relevant documents, designs, requirement specifications, etc. for team reference

authorization.title: Sprint Permissions
authorization.onTips: When 'Permission Control' is enabled, users need to be manually granted sprint permissions to perform corresponding operations. Permission control is enabled by default. Note: If the authorized user does not have parent project permissions, view permissions will be automatically granted.
authorization.offTips: When 'No Permission Control' is enabled, all users can publicly view and operate the current sprint. Users also need to have permissions for the parent project of the current sprint.

upload.uploadTip: You can directly drag files into this area for direct upload. File size should not exceed 20M, supporting .xls .xlsx file types.

messages.exportingInProgress: You have issues being exported, please try again later
messages.reopenTip: Update issue status to 'Pending', do not clear statistics count and status.
messages.restartTip: Update issue to 'Pending', related statistics count and status will be cleared.
messages.onlyMoveToInProgressOrCanceled: Can only move to In Progress or Canceled
messages.noProcessedPermission: No permission to mark as processed
messages.onlyMoveToConfirmingOrCanceled: Can only move to Confirming or Canceled
messages.onlyMoveToCompletedOrCanceled: Can only move to Completed or Canceled
messages.onlyMoveToCompletedOrCanceledFromConfirm: Can only move to Completed or Canceled
messages.noConfirmer: This issue has no confirmer, no confirmation needed, can only move to Completed or Canceled

tabs.subIssueTip: Used to break down large complex tasks into smaller, more manageable sub-tasks, facilitating team collaboration and division of work.
tabs.assocTaskTip: Track tasks related to this issue to understand dependencies.
tabs.assocRequirementTip: Trace back to original requirements for context and impact analysis.
tabs.assocStoryTip: Trace back to user stories for functional context and impact understanding.
tabs.assocBugTip: Trace back to original requirements for context and impact analysis.
tabs.assocCaseTip: Track test cases related to this issue to understand testing dependencies.
tabs.assocApiTestTip: Link to API testing tasks for progress tracking and API health verification.
tabs.assocScenarioTestTip: Link to scenario testing tasks to validate functionality in real-world usage.

messages.cancelPartialSuccess: {num} selected issues cancelled successfully, {errorNum} issues cancelled failed
messages.favouritePartialSuccess: {num} selected issues favourited successfully, {errorNum} issues favourited failed
messages.cancelFavouriteSuccess: All {num} selected issues cancelled favourite successfully
messages.cancelFavouritePartialSuccess: {num} selected issues unfavourited successfully, {errorNum} issues unfavourited failed
messages.confirmCancelFollow: Are you sure to cancel follow for the selected {num} issues?
messages.followFailed: All {num} selected issues failed to follow
messages.cancelFollowSuccess: All {num} selected issues cancelled follow successfully
messages.cancelFollowPartialSuccess: {num} selected issues unfollowed successfully, {errorNum} issues unfollowed failed
messages.maxBatchLimit: Maximum support batch operation {maxNum} issues, currently selected {selectedNum} issues.

meeting.title: Meeting
meeting.notAddedYet: You haven't added any meetings yet, immediately

introduce.title: About Meeting
introduce.description: Meetings play a key role in agile frameworks, helping teams continuously improve, increase work efficiency, and ensure projects can flexibly respond to changes through regular communication, feedback, and reflection.

meetingTypes.productGroomingDesc: Clarify product vision and near-term goals. Refine and prioritize the backlog to ensure feasibility. Participants: Product Owner, Dev Team, Scrum Master, stakeholders.
meetingTypes.sprintPlanningDesc: Define sprint scope and workload. PO presents backlog; team discusses, estimates, and selects deliverables. Participants: Scrum Master, Product Owner, Dev Team.
meetingTypes.dailyStandupDesc: Sync progress, blockers, and plans in minutes. Keep sprint status visible and collaboration tight.
meetingTypes.sprintReviewDesc: Show deliverables, gather feedback, and update backlog. Align next steps. Participants: Scrum team and stakeholders.
meetingTypes.sprintRetrospectiveDesc: Reflect on process, identify issues and improvements, commit actions for the next sprint. Participants: Scrum team.
meetingTypes.otherDesc: Other agile meetings such as technical/requirement reviews, release planning, impediment removal, team building, etc.

placeholder.inputLocation: Record meeting location or online meeting link

messages.meetingTypeTip: Specify meeting type for identification and management.

issueAnalysis.title: Analysis
issueAnalysis.notCreatedYet: Not created yet, click to create

introduce.title: About Analysis
introduce.description: Provides real-time issue data analysis, supports data-driven decision making, ensures information transparency, enhances team collaboration and issue tracking, and improves project management efficiency. AngusTester includes built-in analysis templates such as burndown charts, backlog issues, and risk assessments to help quickly view dashboards and key performance indicators (KPIs). Users can also customize analysis dashboards based on business needs.

placeholder.inputAnalysisDesc: Enter analysis description, such as analysis purpose, background, etc., maximum 200 characters

messages.confirmUpdateSnapshot: Confirm update snapshot content for analysis 「{name}」?

dataSource.snapshot: Save data snapshot, display snapshot data each time
